msContents.summary: Tax register, recording day by day the collection of money taxes.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto;Two small lines on Verso
+ P.Cair. Inv. 57187; P.Iand. VII, 141; P.Mich. Inv. 2830; 3159; 4910

condition.ab: Regularly cut at the left hand side; a small part of the top shows that it was regularly cut. kollesis at the right hand side of the papyrus, at the payments. The column is split verticaly in two pieces. The fibers are frayed. A big part of the text is lost as a result of the damage. The papyrus was folded at the end of the lines, before the payments. Some original wrinkles can be seen that the scribe had to deal with. Some spots of ink on the Verso. No restoration is needed. (MA)

handDesc.p: Written in a quick but clear cursive. The scribe separated the new entry from the preceding one by underlining the name of the taxpayer and marking an oblique stroke going downwards to the left margin in other lines.
